title: Kaart van het Eiland Borneo (Map of the Island of Borneo)

 Francois
 1666 - 1727

  physical_appearance: The map depicts the island of Borneo
 together with several islands that are much smaller in size. Different colours are used on the different islands
 ranging from pink to turquoise to yellow. The scale that is being utilized in this map is 1 : 30. There are no latitudes and longitudes on this map
 nor are there any black lines that extend out from the compass that is located near its bottom right hand side. There are pictorial representations of hills and mountains
 as well as trees.

  subject_terms_1: colonial settlements islands (landforms)

  subject_terms_2: Colonization East Indies Maps Islands Nederlandsche Oost-Indische Compagnie Expedition Borneo

  sgcool_label_text: Francois Valentijn (1666–1727) was a minister
 naturalist and writer who served the Dutch V.O.C. in the East Indies in the late 17th and early 18th centuries. His monumental work Oud en Nieuw Oost-Indien (Old and New East-India)
 published between 1724 and 1726
 offers a comprehensive mapping of the East Indies with a large selection of scale maps and views. This map of Borneo was published in that work.

metadata.title_text: Kaart van het Eiland Borneo (Map of the Island of Borneo)
metadata.physical_appearance: The map depicts the island of Borneo, together with several islands that are much smaller in size. Different colours are used on the different islands, ranging from pink to turquoise to yellow. The scale that is being utilized in this map is 1 : 30. There are no latitudes and longitudes on this map, nor are there any black lines that extend out from the compass that is located near its bottom right hand side. There are pictorial representations of hills and mountains, as well as trees.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Colonization East Indies Maps Islands Nederlandsche Oost-Indische Compagnie Expedition Borneo
metadata.sgcool_label_text: Francois Valentijn (1666–1727) was a minister, naturalist and writer who served the Dutch V.O.C. in the East Indies in the late 17th and early 18th centuries. His monumental work Oud en Nieuw Oost-Indien (Old and New East-India), published between 1724 and 1726, offers a comprehensive mapping of the East Indies with a large selection of scale maps and views. This map of Borneo was published in that work.
